name: Stovetop Fried Coconut Shrimp
author: Charles
summary: This do-it-yourself coconut shrimp recipe cooks quickly on your stove. I have a 9-inch skillet with slightly taller sides than usual; that's my favorite.
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
½ cup sweetened shredded coconut, or more as needed
½ cup unsweetened shredded coconut, or more as needed
1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Fill a 9-inch cast iron skillet with 1/2 inch of peanut oil
Clip a thermometer onto the side of the skillet and turn heat to medium-high; heat oil to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place several layers of paper towels on a platter; set aside
Whisk salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper in a small bowl until even in color
Add cornstarch and mix until blended
Whisk eggs thoroughly in a second bowl
Mix sweetened and unsweetened coconut in a third bowl until well combined
Dredge each shrimp in the cornstarch mixture until thoroughly coated; set on a plate
Dip each shrimp in egg and then roll in the coconut mixture, pressing a reasonable amount of coconut onto shrimp
Place shrimp, one at a time, into the hot oil, going counterclockwise
Cook until meat is opaque, another 20 to 60 seconds more
Place shrimp on the prepared platter and allow to drain while you cook the remaining shrimp
Allow the oil to return to temperature between batches
